Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Jones: 99999/5 ‚≠ê06/12/2025 04:44 PM

üíñ1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

(I'll do this as soon as we get new assembly numbers)
üíñ1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

The bill is considered passed. <:checkmark:1325536400619081758>
Senator Rosen04/13/2025 05:53 AM
On the matter of P.B. 3.,

The vote is
41 aye | 59 nay | 0 abstaining

The bill is considered failed. <:crossmark:1325536402334552114>

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

üíñ1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1

Riemann Hersey06/12/2025 04:53 PM
# Speech to the assembly regarding the soon to be proposed SPHERE Act:

People of Pacifica, it is clear that the Pacifican People want the Obsidian Sphere, given that this has been a campaign promise I have focused on for over 3 months. However, I am sympathetic to Pacifican's who voted for Jack Francis over me, Jack Francis had a much more focused campaign and administration where he focused on the Health of Pacificans. As such, I see the election results as showing that Pacifican's wanted the sphere, but still cared about the health priorities of this beautiful state.

I have come up with a bill that will help accomplish both of these goals, thus fufilling the electoral wishes of those who voted for me and those who voted for Jack Francis. One of the greatest health failures of the modern age is the large availability and consumption of alcohol and sugary drinks, with both of these products leading to huge amounts of health issues for people in Pacifica, along with sugary drinks heavily contributing to the obesity epidemic, and child obesity epidemic, in Pacifica. It is quite frankly absurd that children could go to the nearest 7/11 and buy a big gulp for $2.50 bucks which would contain more sugar than they should consume in a week.

As such, I am planning to propose a 100% tax on all alcohol and soda sales, in an effort to radically decrease the consumption of these products and accurately price in the damage these products cause to the health of the citizens.

With the funding from this tax, we will build the Obsidian Sphere in the San Francisco Bay, my primary campaign promise, and the electoral mandate I was elected on.

I hereby introduce P.B 1, a bill meant to honor the Legacy and Priorities of <@701838733812695150> while ushering in a new era of Pacifican Brilliance.
‚ÄºÔ∏è1
